title: Rust Engineer
description:
As an hourly paid, fully remote Rust Engineer for AI Data Training, you will review AI\\-generated Rust code and explanations or generate your own, evaluate the reasoning quality and step\\-by\\-step problem\\-solving, and provide expert feedback that helps models produce answers that are accurate, logical, and clearly explained. You will assess solutions for correctness, safety, and adherence to the prompt; identify errors in ownership, borrowing, lifetimes, or algorithmic reasoning; fact\\-check information; write high\\-quality explanations and model solutions that demonstrate idiomatic Rust patterns; and rate and compare multiple AI responses based on correctness and reasoning quality.
   

  

 This role is with SME Careers, a fast\\-growing AI Data Services company and subsidiary of SuperAnnotate that provides AI training data for many of the worldâ€™s largest AI companies and foundation model labs. Your work will directly help improve the worldâ€™s premier AI models while giving you the flexibility of impactful, detail\\-oriented remote contract work.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop AI Training Content: Create detailed prompts in various topics and responses to guide AI learning, ensuring the models reflect a comprehensive understanding of diverse subjects.
* Optimize AI Performance: Evaluate and rank AI responses to enhance the model's accuracy, fluency, and contextual relevance.
* Ensure Model Integrity: Test AI models for potential inaccuracies or biases, validating their reliability across use cases.


**Your Profile**
* 1â€“2\\+ years of professional Rust development experience in backend, CLI, or systems\\-focused projects.
* Strong understanding of Rustâ€™s ownership, borrowing, and lifetime model, with the ability to reason clearly about aliasing and data races.
* Solid software engineering experience in at least one of backend services, command\\-line tools, or systems programming using Rust.
* Ability to evaluate safe, idiomatic Rust code, including appropriate use of traits, generics, pattern matching, and error handling.
* Significant experience using LLMs or AI coding assistants while programming, combined with a disciplined approach to validating their output.
* Excellent English writing skills, capable of producing precise, structured, and pedagogical technical explanations.
* Minimum Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science or a closely related technical field.
* Previous experience with AI data training, code review at scale, or evaluation of AI\\-generated technical content is strongly preferred; Minimum C1 English proficiency and an extremely detail\\-oriented working style are required.
* Highly preferred: experience with Tokio, Actix, Serde, and async Rust patterns in production or advanced side projects.
* Preferred: competitive programming experience, contributions to Rust open\\-source ecosystems, and demonstrated ability to reason about performance, concurrency, and correctness in Rust code.

* Ensure on\\-time, high\\-quality deliverables aligned with project governance and client standards.


**Required Skills \\& Experience**
* Technical Expertise: 3â€“5 years of hands\\-on experience in Primavera Unifier, including uDesigner, Shell Manager, Data Structure, and Integration Framework.
* Integrations: Experience with Unifier Web Services, REST APIs, and middleware platforms (adapters).
* Reporting: Proficiency in BI Publisher, XML templates, and SQL queries.
* Database: Working knowledge of Oracle SQL.
* Configuration Management: Experience managing configurations, environments, and migration processes.
* Testing \\& Documentation: Ability to prepare test cases, perform UAT, and document configuration details systematically.
* Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective coordination with onshore teams.
* Certifications (Preferred): Oracle Primavera Unifier Certified Implementation Specialist.


**Nice To Have**
* Exposure to Primavera P6, Aconex, or SAP integration scenarios.
* Experience in construction, infrastructure, or capital project domains.
* Knowledge of Stage Gate, or Project Governance processes.


**Education**
* Bachelorâ€™s degree in engineering, Computer Science, or Information Technology (or equivalent).

title: Member Technical Staff III
description:
**Job Description**
**Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?**
 Omnissa is on its accelerated path to become the ubiquitous platform of choice for hosting their multi\\-cloud workloads as they surge ahead with their digital transformation journey to deliver value their customers through innovation. Horizon Enterprise (HzE) platform is one of the key engine on which Omnissa's multi\\-cloud offering is built.
   

  

 HzE enables our customers to centrally and securely manage and administer the "Virtual Desktop Infrastructure" assets either on premise or on the cloud, of their choice, while providing rich experience to their end\\-users as the world's workforce adopts the work from anywhere culture, in this post\\-covid era.
   

  

 With nearly 2 decades of mission critical deployment of HzE platform across major industry verticals like health care, financials, defence, telecom, media \\& entertainment et al it has become a solution trusted and valued by tens of thousands of our customers with millions of seat deployments.
   

  

 As an esteemed member of the Horizon Enterprise Connection Server team you will have the opportunity to contribute and shape how our customers embrace their digital transformation journey with the power to seamlessly develop and deploy their solutions across multi\\-cloud and hybrid\\-cloud without the fear of getting locked\\-in by the cloud vendor.
   

  

 As one of the engineers in the team you will have the ability and power to contribute and influence the highly available/reliable/scalable/secured solution architecture and design in a heavily distributed VDI brokering and inventory management space, partnering with some of the brightest minds in the industry. This position also lends itself to mentoring and shaping junior engineers in the team through technical guidance on design, quality and coding through continuous reviews, discussions and feedbacks. You will also have opportunity to innovate and disrupt the status\\-quo through your individual contribution and collaborative cross functional partnerships.
   

  

**Success in the Role: What are the performance outcomes over the first 6\\-12 months you will work towards completing?**
 As a successful lead engineer you would have accomplished the following by the end of 1st year with the team.
   

  

* You would have interacted with senior architects on the product and participate in the architecture and design of some of the business critical features of the product.
* You would have hands\\-on created and delivered highly scalable new features/enhancement in the core VDI brokering area of Horizon Enterprise with exemplary quality.
* You would have reviewed \\~100 code reviews raised by junior/peer engineers of the team and would have gained significant hands\\-on knowledge on the Horizon Enterprise Connection Server code base.
* You would have gained good knowledge and be able to guide and contribute in the area of Federated task management, VDI inventory management, High availability et al.
* You would have participated in test strategy and test plan review on various areas of the product.
* You would have contributed to team building by participating in hiring interviews.
* You would have attended multiple KT session and would have delivered a few to learn and also enable your team members.


**The Work: What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?**
 As an active individual contributor and a security leader of the team you will be primarily focusing on securing HzE and put to use your extensive knowledge and expertise in the areas of OpenSSL, BouncyCastle, CryptoNext Gen API, JNI, CNG APIs, JCA, Windows Active Directory, Windows API et al. Hands\\-on experience in SASL, Kerberos, OpenID Connect, NTLM, GSS API, SAML, RADIUS, RSA framework/protocols would be value add.
   

  

 Your focus would be to review the design of new features which are getting developed and provide security approval. Along with other team members ensure to fix the vulnerabilities that are discovered during security scans (OSSPI, Nessus \\& Coverity) to be compliant. Responsible to review security compliance in each of the HzE release and provide inputs. You should have security expertise with hands on experience, willing to groom and actively mentor juniors to bring security mindset in the team.
   

  

**What is the leadership like for this role? What is the structure and culture of the team like?**
 This role will be reporting to the Manager/Senior Manager of Engineering. The team consists of highly competent senior and junior engineers working closely as a team. Our team's focus is on challenging the status quo by innovating but at the same time getting stuff done. We believe in building trust amongst all our stakeholders (team members, PM, RM, Doc, Support, Customer Engineering \\& Exec) and committing to make our customers successful. The team is organised based on modules to define clear responsibility and accountability. At the same time teams are fluid enough to own up whatever is needed for the larger product to be successful. The team is transparent in communication and help build synergy with each other for the success of overall team. We believe engineers are the most valuable asset of our company and team. We put extra emphasis on providing great work life balance and having fun at work. As a team/company we actively promote "Diversity and Inclusion" while consciously keeping any un\\-conscious bias at bay!
   

  

**Where is this role located?**
 Flexible: The role is considered flexible and will be a mix of working from a local Omnissa office and remote depending on your preferences and the arrangements determined with your future manager. You will be expected to live within a reasonable non\\-daily commute of the office.
   

  

**What are the benefits and perks of working at Omnissa?**
 You and your loved ones will be supported with a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Below are some highlights:
   

  

* Medical Coverage, Retirement, and Parental Leave Plans for All Family Types
* Generous Time Off Programs
* 40 hours of paid time to volunteer in your community
* Rethink's Neurodiversity program to support parents raising children with learning or behaviour challenges, or developmental disabilities
* Financial contributions to your ongoing development (conference participation, trainings, course work, etc.)
* Wellness reimbursement and online fitness and wellbeing classes

title: Backend Support Engineer (Node.js & MongoDB)
description:
**Experience** 
 : 4\\.00 \\+ years
   

  

**Salary** 
 : INR 2000000\\-3000000 / year (based on experience)
   

  

**Expected Notice Period** 
 : 7 Days
   

  

**Shift** 
 : (GMT\\+05:30\\) Asia/Kolkata (IST)
   

  

**Opportunity Type** 
 : Remote
   

  

**Placement Type** 
 : Full Time Permanent position(Payroll and Compliance to be managed by: A Series A funded California based Software Development Company)
   

  

 (\\*Note: This is a requirement for one of Uplers' client \\- A Series A funded California based Software Development Company)
   

  

 What do you need for this opportunity?
   

  

**Must have skills required:**
 compliance standards such as SOC\\-2 and GDPR, aggregation frameworks, GraphQL, AWS, MongoDB, Node Js, Aggregation queries
   

  

**A Series A funded California based Software Development Company is Looking for:**
**About The Role**
 We are seeking an experienced Support Engineer to handle backend debugging, production triage, and performance optimization across our AWS\\-hosted Node.js, GraphQL, and MongoDB stack.
   

  

 This role is backend\\-heavy and critical to maintaining uptime, reliability, and customer satisfaction.
   

  

 Support Engineers will also contribute a portion of their working hours to Quality Assurance (QA). At our startupâ€™s high pace, maintaining consistent knowledge transfer across releases can be difficult. Hands\\-on QA participation helps Support Engineers better understand the product, stay aligned with release changes, and act as an implicit knowledge bridge between product, engineering, and support.
   

  

 You will collaborate closely with engineering, QA, and product teams across US and India time zones to ensure smooth operations and quick resolution of production issues.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Diagnose, debug, and resolve backend issues in Node.js and GraphQL services hosted on AWS Elastic Beanstalk, EC2, and CloudFront
* Write, optimize, and analyze MongoDB aggregation pipelines for analytics, dashboards, and large dataset operations
* Collaborate with QA teams during pre\\-release testing to gain hands\\-on understanding of new features and regression areas
* Participate in QA test cycles to validate bug fixes, API behavior, and production readiness
* Review logs and metrics (AWS CloudWatch, ELB, Beanstalk) to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks
* Work with distributed teams across time zones to ensure smooth handoffs and continuous support coverage
* Contribute to postmortems, documentation, and long\\-term reliability improvements
* Participate in on\\-call rotations and maintain strong communication during incident response


**Technical Skills**
**Core Expertise:**
* Deep hands\\-on experience with MongoDB aggregation frameworks and query optimization
* Proficiency in Node.js (Express / Apollo Server) and GraphQL schema or resolver design


**Infrastructure Knowledge:**
* Experience with AWS Beanstalk, EC2, CloudFront, S3, and ELB
* Familiarity with logging and observability tools such as CloudWatch, New Relic, or Datadog
* Additional Skills:
* REST and GraphQL API debugging
* Understanding of frontend\\-backend data flow (React familiarity is a plus)
* Experience with GitHub Actions, CI/CD pipelines, and deployment troubleshooting


**Soft Skills**
* Strong analytical and debugging mindset
* Clear communicator across distributed teams
* Ownership\\-oriented with a focus on stability and long\\-term solutions
* Comfortable working in US primary hours with defined India\\-time overlap for collaboration
* Adaptable to startup environments and eager to learn through direct product exposure and QA involvement


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior experience in SaaS or multi\\-tenant systems
* Exposure to microservices or event\\-driven architecture
* Understanding of data security and compliance standards such as SOC\\-2 and GDPR


 Engagement Type: Fulltime
   

  

 Direct\\-hire on the Delightree payroll
   

  

 Shift time\\-
 **11 PM to 4AM IST** 
 (Remaining IST Time)
   

  

 Job Type: Permanent
   

  

 Location: Remote
   

  

 Interview Process \\- 3 Rounds
   

  

**How to apply for this opportunity?**
* Step 1: Click On Apply! And Register or Login on our portal.
* Step 2: Complete the Screening Form \\& Upload updated Resume
* Step 3: Increase your chances to get shortlisted \\& meet the client for the Interview!


**About Uplers:**
 Our goal is to make hiring reliable, simple, and fast. Our role will be to help all our talents find and apply for relevant contractual onsite opportunities and progress in their career. We will support any grievances or challenges you may face during the engagement.
   

  

 (Note: There are many more opportunities apart from this on the portal. Depending on the assessments you clear, you can apply for them as well).
   

  

 So, if you are ready for a new challenge, a great work environment, and an opportunity to take your career to the next level, don't hesitate to apply today. We are waiting for you!

title: Principal Software Engineer - OpenShift
description:
**About The Job**
 OpenShift Container Platform is Red Hatâ€™s premier container initiative, which oversees multiple product lines. It includes a container optimized Linux based operating system called Red Hat CoreOS and an orchestration PaaS framework called OpenShift based on Kubernetes.
   

  

 The OpenShift Engineering team is looking for a Software Engineer to join us in Pune, India. In this role, you will work as part of a team, building the next\\-generation installation and management technology for the Red Hat OpenShift. Youâ€™ll be a key member of our OpenShift team and focus on building world\\-class technologies demonstrating Red Hatâ€™s thought and market leadership in hybrid cloud, system engineering, and Kubernetes management. As a Software Engineer, you will be expected to work in an Agile environment to help keep our products and services competitive with the ever\\-changing landscape that is containers. Weâ€™re looking for engineers who are interested in working on OpenShift, Kubernetes, operating systems, continuous integration, and more.
   

  

 What will you do?
   

  

* Provide technical leadership and architectural guidance to teams working on Red Hat OpenShift, ensuring alignment with product vision and best practices.
* Drive the delivery of key OpenShift features by contributing to both upstream and downstream Red Hat OpenShift projects, fostering innovation and technical excellence.
* Effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non\\-technical audiences, including end\\-users, stakeholders, and the open\\-source community.
* Mentor and coach other engineers on the OpenShift team, fostering their technical growth and development.
* Develop and deliver high\\-quality features and bug fixes for Kubernetes and OpenShift components within an agile development team and a global organization.
* Champion product quality through proactive participation in peer code reviews, ensuring adherence to coding standards and best practices.
* Contribute to and maintain continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipelines to ensure rapid and reliable software releases.
* Serve as a key point of escalation for the implementation of critical customer\\-driven features and the resolution of high\\-priority bugs.
* Demonstrate awareness and leverage AI tools (like Claude, Cursor, etc.) throughout the product development lifecycle, exploring their potential to improve efficiency, code quality, and innovation.


 What will you bring?
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent work experience
* Minimum 8 years of experience with software development with proven track record of working on enterprise level projects
* Experience writing code in any of the programming languages, including Python, Go, C/C\\+\\+
* Demonstrated working knowledge of container technologies, podman and Kubernetes.
* Knowledge of Git, GitHub, and/or JIRA is required
* Experience utilizing major cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and Microsoft Azure.
* Familiarity with DevOps principles, including Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) and automation practices.
* Demonstrated proficiency in problem\\-solving, coupled with innovative thinking and a strong customer\\-centric approach


**The Following Are Considered As a Plus**
* Proficiency in Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL), CoreOS, Fedora, or Red Hat OpenShift
* Previous experience contributing to open source community software development
* Follow the Kubernetes community and proactively lead the implementation of important improvements from the project in our product
* Familiarity with enterprise application development, utilizing agile or scrum methodologies, and competence with various observability tools for monitoring, logging, and profiling is desirable.


**About Red Hat**
 Red Hat is the worldâ€™s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community\\-powered approach to deliver high\\-performing Linux, cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Spread across 40\\+ countries, our associates work flexibly across work environments, from in\\-office, to office\\-flex, to fully remote, depending on the requirements of their role. Red Hatters are encouraged to bring their best ideas, no matter their title or tenure. We're a leader in open source because of our open and inclusive environment. We hire creative, passionate people ready to contribute their ideas, help solve complex problems, and make an impact.
   

  

**Inclusion at Red Hat**
 Red Hatâ€™s culture is built on the open source principles of transparency, collaboration, and inclusion, where the best ideas can come from anywhere and anyone. When this is realized, it empowers people from different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to come together to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and drive innovation. Our aspiration is that everyone experiences this culture with equal opportunity and access, and that all voices are not only heard but also celebrated. We hope you will join our celebration, and we welcome and encourage applicants from all the beautiful dimensions that compose our global village.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Policy (EEO)**
 Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.
   

  

 Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.
   

  

 Red Hat supports individuals with disabilities and provides reasonable accommodations to job applicants. If you need assistance completing our online job application, email application\\-assistance@redhat.com. General inquiries, such as those regarding the status of a job application, will not receive a reply.

title: Principal Software Maintenance Engineer - OpenShift
description:
**About The Job**
 Red Hat is seeking a strong Principal Software Maintenance Engineer to join us in Pune, India. Come join one of the fastest growing enterprise software and services companies and the leader of open source software. This opportunity is a tremendous chance to become part of a fast\\-paced, leading edge company that is changing the way software is developed, sold and supported.
   

  

 Red Hat's Global Support Services organization is dedicated to resolving the issues of our enterprise customers quickly and effectively. The Global Support Engineering Group provides high\\-level technical support and engineering services designed to maximize up\\-time and reduce IT costs.
   

  

 Our Principal Software Maintenance Engineer maintains close working relationships with our customer \\& assists our technical support engineers with the most complex and challenging issues.
   

  

**What will you do?**
* Deliver high\\-tier technical solutions for Red Hat OpenShift enterprise environments, ensuring the stability and scalability of mission\\-critical deployments.
* Orchestrate Global Support Operations within a 24x7 follow\\-the\\-sun model, maintaining seamless service continuity and excellence across diverse time zones and shifts.
* Mitigate Complex System Failures by deep\\-diving into OpenShift core components and integrated microservices to resolve high\\-stakes architectural bottlenecks.
* Collaborate Cross\\-Functionally with Production Support, Technical Account Managers (TAMs), and Engineering teams to align customer feedback with product roadmaps.
* Leverage Advanced Generative AI \\& LLMs (e.g., Google Gemini) to accelerate the support lifecycle through sophisticated prompt engineering, multi\\-dimensional research, and the synthesis of complex technical documentation into actionable intelligence.
* Pioneer AI\\-Integrated Workflows by proactively experimenting with emerging AI technologies to optimize OpenShift troubleshooting frameworks and internal tooling.
* Drive Problem\\-Solving Efficiency by utilizing AI to deconstruct intricate technical data, draft high\\-precision stakeholder communications, and brainstorm novel solutions for unprecedented edge cases.
* Strategic Execution \\& Documentation
* Exercise Expert Judgment in selecting and refining methodologies for incident resolution, balancing immediate mitigation with long\\-term system integrity.
* Curate Knowledge Base by documenting comprehensive root\\-cause analyses and technical investigations to serve as a gold standard for global support.
* Engineer Self\\-Service Ecosystems by developing reusable, automated diagnostic tools and self\\-healing solutions to preemptively resolve future incidents.
* Manage High\\-Pressure Workloads with a focus on prioritizing critical path issues, ensuring all enterprise\\-level engagements are driven to a timely and successful resolution.


**What will you bring?**
* A minimum of 8\\+ years experience as a Principal Software Maintenance Engineer or other directly related experience in an enterprise environment.
* Expert\\-level proficiency in the administration, kernel\\-level tuning, and lifecycle management of Enterprise Linux distributions.
* Deep architectural understanding of Kubernetes and Red Hat OpenShift, including low\\-level component interaction, Operator frameworks, and control\\-plane stability.
* Comprehensive knowledge of computer architecture, high\\-performance networking (SDN), and complex storage paradigms (CSI, software\\-defined storage, and persistent volume management).
* Proven experience deploying and maintaining large\\-scale production environments across AWS, Azure, and GCP, with a focus on cloud\\-interoperability and managed service integration.
* Extensive background in overseeing Large Distributed Systems, including the ability to navigate and debug microservices architectures at scale.
* Commitment to providing the best experience possible for Red Hat customers by adopting a customer first mindset.
* Prompt Engineering for Support: Proven ability to craft structured, iterative prompts to extract root\\-cause analysis from complex technical data.
* Context Injection: Experience providing LLMs with relevant logs, error traces, and documentation snippets to generate accurate, context\\-aware resolutions.
* Validation \\& Fact\\-Checking: A disciplined approach to "human\\-in\\-the\\-loop" verificationâ€”vetting AI\\-generated code or solutions for "hallucinations" and security vulnerabilities before implementation.
* BSc or higher in Computer Science or other technical discipline or equivalent work experience


**About Red Hat**
 Red Hat is the worldâ€™s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community\\-powered approach to deliver high\\-performing Linux, cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Spread across 40\\+ countries, our associates work flexibly across work environments, from in\\-office, to office\\-flex, to fully remote, depending on the requirements of their role. Red Hatters are encouraged to bring their best ideas, no matter their title or tenure. We're a leader in open source because of our open and inclusive environment. We hire creative, passionate people ready to contribute their ideas, help solve complex problems, and make an impact.
   

  

**Inclusion at Red Hat**
 Red Hatâ€™s culture is built on the open source principles of transparency, collaboration, and inclusion, where the best ideas can come from anywhere and anyone. When this is realized, it empowers people from different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to come together to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and drive innovation. Our aspiration is that everyone experiences this culture with equal opportunity and access, and that all voices are not only heard but also celebrated. We hope you will join our celebration, and we welcome and encourage applicants from all the beautiful dimensions that compose our global village.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Policy (EEO)**
 Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.
   

  

 Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.
   

  

 Red Hat supports individuals with disabilities and provides reasonable accommodations to job applicants. If you need assistance completing our online job application, email application\\-assistance@redhat.com. General inquiries, such as those regarding the status of a job application, will not receive a reply.

title: Senior Lead Software Engineer, Back End (Bangkok based, Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 At Agoda, we bridge the world through travel. Our story began in 2005, when two lifelong friends and entrepreneurs, driven by their passion for travel, launched Agoda to make it easier for everyone to explore the world.
   

  

 Today, we are part of Booking Holdings \\[NASDAQ: BKNG], with a diverse team of over 7,000 people from 90 countries, working together in offices around the globe. Every day, we connect people to destinations and experiences, with our great deals across our millions of hotels and holiday properties, flights, and experiences worldwide.
   

  

 No two days are the same at Agoda. Data and technology are at the heart of our culture, fueling our curiosity and innovation. If youâ€™re ready to begin your best journey and help build travel for the world, join us.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agodaâ€™s Back End Engineering department, we build the scalable, fault\\-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. These mission\\-critical systems change frequently with dozens of releases per day, so we must employ state\\-of\\-the\\-art CI/CD and testing techniques in order to make sure everything works without any downtime. We also ensure that our systems are self\\-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. In order to accomplish this, we use state\\-of\\-the\\-art languages like Scala and Go, data technologies like Kafka and Aerospike, and agile development practices. Most importantly though, we hire great people from all around the world and empower them to be successful. Whether itâ€™s building new projects like Flights and Packages or reimagining our existing business, youâ€™ll make a big impact as part of the Back End Engineering team.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission\\-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting\\-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**In this Role, you'll get to:**
* Architecting and developing highly scalable, mission critical back end systems
* Owning a big chunk of Agodaâ€™s system all the way from the north\\-star \\& vision down to the bytecode level
* Enabling impactful collaboration and cross\\-team projects on big projects, making a dent in the quality of our services, code \\& architecture
* Providing thoughtful feedback, nurture an inclusive engineering environment, and champion engineering fundamentals. Bring out the best from your fellow engineers.
* Identifying and implementing opportunities for optimization across the technology stack, focusing on cost, efficiency, velocity \\& dev happiness
* Exhibiting technical leadership throughout the broader organization, conveying complex technical trade\\-offs to non\\-techies such as business owners \\& C\\-suite executives.


**What you'll Need to Succeed:**
* Overall experience of 10\\+ years in software engineering roles
* Proven hands\\-on experience, Experience with owning production services with significant impact on design, development, deployment, monitoring \\& evolution
* Curiosity, staying a\\-breast on technological improvements and open source advancement.
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Kotlin, Scala, Java, C\\#.
* Can perform deep research \\& take decisions on complex projects. Can easily toggle between running as a lone wolf and also works great as part of a pack
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical details to stakeholders at all levels.
* On top of being an expert in Back End, has understanding of challenges and trade\\-offs in the entire engineering universe, from Front End/ Mobile to Data 7 analytics
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.


**It's Great if you have:**
* Master's or Ph.D. in a technical field
* Experience with Kubernetes for effective container orchestration and scaling
* Deep understanding of CI/CD pipelines, automation tools, and practices relevant to machine learning.
* Experience in programming with Rust, C or other low level language


**This position is based in Bangkok, Thailand. (Relocation support is provided)**

Additional Information: \\- The candidate should have minimum 3 years of experience in Microsoft Power Business Intelligence (BI). \\- This position is based at our Coimbatore office. \\- A 15 years full time education is required.

**Incept Labs is Looking for:******
**Senior Data Engineer**
**About Us**
 Incept Labs is an AI research lab based in San Francisco, California. Our small team of scientists, engineers, and builders is passionate about developing domain\\-specific, next\\-generation AI solutions to enhance education and research. Backed by marquee investors and scientific collaborators, we believe in a future where humans and AI work together side by side. Together, AI processes knowledge at scale while humans contribute imagination, values, and lived experience, creating new ways to discover, adapt, and grow.
   

  

**About This Role**
 We''re looking for a Software Engineer with deep expertise in large\\-scale data processing for LLM development. Data engineering is critical to successful model training and evaluation. You''ll work directly with researchers to accelerate experiments, develop new datasets, improve infrastructure efficiency, and enable key insights across our data assets.
   

  

 Youâ€™ll join a high\\-impact, compact team responsible for both architecture and scaling of Inceptâ€™s data and model development infrastructure, and work with highly complex, multi\\-modal data.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and operate scalable, fault\\-tolerant data infrastructure to support distributed computing and data orchestration for LLM Research
* Develop and maintain high\\-throughput systems for data ingestion, processing, and transformation to support LLM model development
* Develop synthetic datasets using state\\-of\\-the\\-art solutions
* Collaborate with research teams to deliver critical data assets for model development and evaluation
* Implement and maintain monitoring and alerting to support platform reliability and performance
* Build systems for traceability, reproducibility, and robust quality control to ensure adherence to industry compliance standards


**Required Qualifications**
* 5\\+ years of experience in data infrastructure, ideally supporting high\\-scale applications or research platforms.
* Fluent in distributed computing frameworks.
* Deeply familiar with cloud infrastructure, data storage architectures, and batch \\+ streaming pipelines.
* Experience with specialized hardware (GPUs, TPUs) computing and GPU cluster.
* Strong knowledge of databases, storage systems, and how architecture choices impact performance at scale.
* Familiar with microservices architectures, containerization and orchestration, and both synchronous and asynchronous processing.
* Extensive experience with performance optimization and memory management in high\\-volume data systems.
* Proactive about documentation, automation, testing, and empowering your teammates with good tooling.


 This role is fully remote, India\\-based. Compensation and benefits will vary based on background, skills, and experience levels.

title: Senior Shopify Engineer
description:
**Experience** 
 : 5\\.00 \\+ years
   

  

**Salary** 
 : Confidential (based on experience)
   

  

**Expected Notice Period** 
 : 15 Days
   

  

**Shift** 
 : (GMT\\-05:00\\) America/Chicago (CDT)
   

  

**Opportunity Type** 
 : Remote
   

  

**Placement Type** 
 : Full Time Contract for 12 Months(40 hrs a week/160 hrs a month)
   

  

**(\\*Note: This is a requirement for one of Uplers' client \\- Digital Agency)
   

  

**What do you need for this opportunity?
   

  

**Must have skills required:**
 client consultation, ERPs/CRMs/OMS/PIMs, headless commerce, Shopify functions, Technical Leadership, Ci/Cd Pipelines, Custom Shopify apps, shopify cli, Shopify GraphQL API, Shopify Plus, Shopify storefront api, Git, Node Js
   

  

**Digital Agency is Looking for:******
**Senior Shopify Engineer**
 We are seeking a Senior Shopify Engineer with lead potential to architect enterprise\\-level commerce solutions and steer our technical direction. This role requires a blend of deep frontend mastery and sophisticated backend integration skills, combined with the ability to navigate complex problem statements and mentor a growing development team.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Senior Shopify Engineer, you will bridge the gap between business requirements and technical architecture. You will collaborate closely with our Lead Architect to contribute to technical discovery sessions, design custom integrations for Shopify Plus merchants, and own the development of the most complex platform features. A core part of this role involves technical leadership: you will navigate the solution path for complex projects, groom technical stories, and delegate specific implementation tasks to the Shopify Engineering team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborative Discovery: Work alongside the Architect during client\\-facing discovery sessions to identify technical risks and opportunities. Use your depth of experience to guide conversations and translate merchant needs into robust technical roadmaps.
* Advanced Development: Act as the primary developer for the most difficult and nuanced project components. You are expected to be hands\\-on, developing complex solutions rather than simply handing off designs.
* Backlog Grooming \\& Handoff: Define technical tasks and specifications for Shopify Engineers. Groom user stories into actionable development tasks, providing the necessary technical context for the base engineering team to succeed.
* Solution Architecture: Contribute to the technical design of enterprise\\-scale Shopify Plus stores, making critical decisions on theme architecture vs. custom app builds vs. third\\-party integrations.
* Advanced Integrations: Architect and implement secure connections between Shopify and enterprise systems (ERPs, CRMs, OMS, and PIMs) using GraphQL and REST APIs.
* Shopify Plus Mastery: Spearhead the implementation of advanced Plus features, including Checkout Extensibility, Shopify Functions, B2B logic, and complex metaobject architectures.
* Performance \\& Security: Support and help drive the end\\-to\\-end performance strategy and security posture for high\\-volume stores, ensuring scalability during peak traffic events (Black Friday/Cyber Monday).


**Required Skills \\& Experience**
* 5\\+ years of professional frontend or full\\-stack experience, with at least 3 years dedicated to the Shopify platform.
* Advanced Platform Knowledge: Expert\\-level mastery of Shopify Plus, including its limitations and extensibility points.
* API Expertise: Deep experience with the Shopify GraphQL Admin API and Storefront API.
* Backend Proficiency: Ability to build and maintain custom Shopify apps (Node.js/Remix or similar) or middleware when off\\-the\\-shelf solutions are insufficient.
* Modern Tooling: Expertise in Shopify CLI, CI/CD pipelines for commerce, and advanced Git workflows.
* Strategic Problem Solving: Proven track record of solving "non\\-standard" commerce problems that require moving beyond Liquid templates.


**Architectural Leadership**
* Technology Selection: Ability to articulate the trade\\-offs between different technical approaches (e.g., Headless vs. Hydrogen vs. Liquid\\-first) to both internal teams and clients.
* Problem Finding: A proactive approach to identifying technical debt or performance bottlenecks before they impact the merchantâ€™s bottom line.


**Soft Skills**
* Leadership \\& Delegation: Strong ability to break down complex project goals into actionable tasks for other developers.
* Client Consultation: Excellent communication skills to lead technical discussions with enterprise\\-level stakeholders.
* Decision Making: Confidence in making high\\-stakes technical choices and standing by them under project pressure.


**How to apply for this opportunity?**
* Step 1: Click On Apply! And Register or Login on our portal.
* Step 2: Complete the Screening Form \\& Upload updated Resume
* Step 3: Increase your chances to get shortlisted \\& meet the client for the Interview!


**About Uplers:**
 Our goal is to make hiring reliable, simple, and fast. Our role will be to help all our talents find and apply for relevant contractual onsite opportunities and progress in their career. We will support any grievances or challenges you may face during the engagement.
   

  

 (Note: There are many more opportunities apart from this on the portal. Depending on the assessments you clear, you can apply for them as well).
   

  

 So, if you are ready for a new challenge, a great work environment, and an opportunity to take your career to the next level, don't hesitate to apply today. We are waiting for you!

**Digital Agency is Looking for:******
**Senior Shopify Engineer**
 We are seeking a Senior Shopify Engineer with lead potential to architect enterprise\\-level commerce solutions and steer our technical direction. This role requires a blend of deep frontend mastery and sophisticated backend integration skills, combined with the ability to navigate complex problem statements and mentor a growing development team.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Senior Shopify Engineer, you will bridge the gap between business requirements and technical architecture. You will collaborate closely with our Lead Architect to contribute to technical discovery sessions, design custom integrations for Shopify Plus merchants, and own the development of the most complex platform features. A core part of this role involves technical leadership: you will navigate the solution path for complex projects, groom technical stories, and delegate specific implementation tasks to the Shopify Engineering team.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborative Discovery: Work alongside the Architect during client\\-facing discovery sessions to identify technical risks and opportunities. Use your depth of experience to guide conversations and translate merchant needs into robust technical roadmaps.
* Advanced Development: Act as the primary developer for the most difficult and nuanced project components. You are expected to be hands\\-on, developing complex solutions rather than simply handing off designs.
* Backlog Grooming \\& Handoff: Define technical tasks and specifications for Shopify Engineers. Groom user stories into actionable development tasks, providing the necessary technical context for the base engineering team to succeed.
* Solution Architecture: Contribute to the technical design of enterprise\\-scale Shopify Plus stores, making critical decisions on theme architecture vs. custom app builds vs. third\\-party integrations.
* Advanced Integrations: Architect and implement secure connections between Shopify and enterprise systems (ERPs, CRMs, OMS, and PIMs) using GraphQL and REST APIs.
* Shopify Plus Mastery: Spearhead the implementation of advanced Plus features, including Checkout Extensibility, Shopify Functions, B2B logic, and complex metaobject architectures.
* Performance \\& Security: Support and help drive the end\\-to\\-end performance strategy and security posture for high\\-volume stores, ensuring scalability during peak traffic events (Black Friday/Cyber Monday).


**Required Skills \\& Experience**
* 5\\+ years of professional frontend or full\\-stack experience, with at least 3 years dedicated to the Shopify platform.
* Advanced Platform Knowledge: Expert\\-level mastery of Shopify Plus, including its limitations and extensibility points.
* API Expertise: Deep experience with the Shopify GraphQL Admin API and Storefront API.
* Backend Proficiency: Ability to build and maintain custom Shopify apps (Node.js/Remix or similar) or middleware when off\\-the\\-shelf solutions are insufficient.
* Modern Tooling: Expertise in Shopify CLI, CI/CD pipelines for commerce, and advanced Git workflows.
* Strategic Problem Solving: Proven track record of solving "non\\-standard" commerce problems that require moving beyond Liquid templates.


**Architectural Leadership**
* Technology Selection: Ability to articulate the trade\\-offs between different technical approaches (e.g., Headless vs. Hydrogen vs. Liquid\\-first) to both internal teams and clients.
* Problem Finding: A proactive approach to identifying technical debt or performance bottlenecks before they impact the merchantâ€™s bottom line.


**Soft Skills**
* Leadership \\& Delegation: Strong ability to break down complex project goals into actionable tasks for other developers.
* Client Consultation: Excellent communication skills to lead technical discussions with enterprise\\-level stakeholders.
* Decision Making: Confidence in making high\\-stakes technical choices and standing by them under project pressure.

**Incept Labs is Looking for:******
**Senior Data Engineer**
**About Us**
 Incept Labs is an AI research lab based in San Francisco, California. Our small team of scientists, engineers, and builders is passionate about developing domain\\-specific, next\\-generation AI solutions to enhance education and research. Backed by marquee investors and scientific collaborators, we believe in a future where humans and AI work together side by side. Together, AI processes knowledge at scale while humans contribute imagination, values, and lived experience, creating new ways to discover, adapt, and grow.
   

  

**About This Role**
 We''re looking for a Software Engineer with deep expertise in large\\-scale data processing for LLM development. Data engineering is critical to successful model training and evaluation. You''ll work directly with researchers to accelerate experiments, develop new datasets, improve infrastructure efficiency, and enable key insights across our data assets.
   

  

 Youâ€™ll join a high\\-impact, compact team responsible for both architecture and scaling of Inceptâ€™s data and model development infrastructure, and work with highly complex, multi\\-modal data.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and operate scalable, fault\\-tolerant data infrastructure to support distributed computing and data orchestration for LLM Research
* Develop and maintain high\\-throughput systems for data ingestion, processing, and transformation to support LLM model development
* Develop synthetic datasets using state\\-of\\-the\\-art solutions
* Collaborate with research teams to deliver critical data assets for model development and evaluation
* Implement and maintain monitoring and alerting to support platform reliability and performance
* Build systems for traceability, reproducibility, and robust quality control to ensure adherence to industry compliance standards


**Required Qualifications**
* 5\\+ years of experience in data infrastructure, ideally supporting high\\-scale applications or research platforms.
* Fluent in distributed computing frameworks.
* Deeply familiar with cloud infrastructure, data storage architectures, and batch \\+ streaming pipelines.
* Experience with specialized hardware (GPUs, TPUs) computing and GPU cluster.
* Strong knowledge of databases, storage systems, and how architecture choices impact performance at scale.
* Familiar with microservices architectures, containerization and orchestration, and both synchronous and asynchronous processing.
* Extensive experience with performance optimization and memory management in high\\-volume data systems.
* Proactive about documentation, automation, testing, and empowering your teammates with good tooling.


 This role is fully remote, India\\-based. Compensation and benefits will vary based on background, skills, and experience levels.
